channel.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
channel.description:
Yeah the manual timezone input was correct.
Now having an error when attempting the "whonix-xfce-installer-cli":
Interpreting /home/user/dist-installer-cli-download/Whonix-Xfce-17.3.9.9.Intel_AMD64.ova
OK.
0%...NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG
VBoxManage: error: Appliance import failed VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057) - Invalid argument value (extended info not available) VBoxManage: error: Context: "RTEXITCODE handleImportAppliance(HandlerArg*) at line 1440 of file VBoxManageAppliance.cpp

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
There is currently an issue booting these live iso/img files outside of a UEFI boot

process. The legacy BIOS boot is not possible and it defaults to a grub bootloader

when it is selected, indicating a non-bootable media.

The EFI disk partition is required to boot the OS, without it being installed as a

disk partition, the OS simply will not boot. You are also obliged to select the

UEFI boot option from the boot menu, or the same error occurs.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
A more realistic option might be a WhonixVM installation to persistent Tails USB.

The default ‘amnesic’ user on TailsOS doesn’t have execute permission, only

read and write and so the whonix-xfce-installer-cli will not execute.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
The installation to an external USB was performed using Calamares, yes.

However, the air gapped machine is now acting strangely.

For example, upon re-login, after logging out, the default ‘user’ account was inputted,

but upon entry, the password textbox was removed so that a password couldn’t be

entered, and when ‘login’ was clicked, it would just return to the login interface.

Also, the ‘persistent’ menu options were previously

displayed and selectable. Now, however, this boot menu is not being presented.

The only real change to the device was an ethernet cable was plugged in.

It looks as though the persistent installation has been corrupted somehow.

After having tried both OSes, TailsOS appears the more reliable option

just from an installation and booting standpoint. With TailsOS, there was none

of this kind of thing, just install the image to a medium and then boot, very simple.

With Kick, the persistent install had to be performed on an air gapped machine and

it is using a 64G drive, also the whonix installation required permissions that the

user account did not have, and when ‘sudo’ was used to attain root privileges,

the Whonix installer script errored with ‘cannot install script under root’.

A switch to the persistent ‘admin’ account proceeded to completely corrupt the Kick

installation, resulting in a machine that will not longer present a boot menu and will

not boot. TailsOS is, at this point in time, easier to both install, boot and use.

It would make a lot of sense to create an image with Whonix already installed to

Kick, that way the size of the image is already known and can be installed

with Whonix already installed.

Now the BIOS is unable to detect boot media. The reason isn’t clear.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
You need a to install using Calamares or use distribution morphing.

install using Calamares:

Kicksecure – 25 May 25

Kicksecure Live ISO (via USB) and Installation

Kicksecure Installation Guide. This guide will help you download the ISO image, create your bootable media, and install Kicksecure on your computer.

*See step: Install Kicksecure (Optional)

Persistent mode:

Kicksecure – 14 May 25

Persistent Mode for Kicksecure

Persistent mode for Kicksecure.

Distribution morphing:

Kicksecure – 18 May 25

Install Kicksecure inside Debian

Kicksecure can be installed on top of an existing Debian installation.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
it was installed to a USB, is that sufficient?

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Is this a duplicate of:

Kicksecure/Whonix LiveUSB distromorph Support
Tried to install Kick on an external USB using the calamares installer, but it actually wiped out the MBR on the hard disk of the computer instead of writing the partitions to the external USB drive even though thats what was selected for write operation. Write to USB stick also didn’t work and will not boot, OS is not detected by BIOS. How shoudl proceed?

?

Warning.

Moderation comment:

Stop posting about whonix-xfce-installer-cli unless you successfully installed Kicksecure to hard drive.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
Can you explain this further? The issue is a lack of disk space on a fairly large USB drive, or it is a RAM limitation?

This could be a permissions limitation?

When this script is run with ‘sudo’ it returns error about not running as root.

It is a circular logic problem? You need root permissions, but can’t run

the script as root.

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
By the way, the systemcheck command failing is what prompted the

output “–set-home clock-random-manual-gui”

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: xianhua
item.description:
64 G drive, how large are these VMs?

What is size of Whonix install? could be RAM limitation?

what are disk space and RAM requirements?

Read full topic

item.title: VBoxManage error: Code NS_ERROR_INVALID_ARG (0x80070057)
item.dc:creator: extraextra
item.description:
xianhua:

0x80070057

Let me google that for you.

Insufficient disk space.

Read full topic
